intro: Purshia tigarea, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert environments. Purshia tigarea is adapted to arid conditions and is an important plant for both wildlife and ecological restoration efforts.
